description: Concordia is the essence of what I like in a game. Fast turns, meaningful decisions, simple yet deep game play. There is very little to dislike about Concordia - a top game for me.  9/2019 Update: After a bunch of plays this has actually decreased for me. I like this, but I think the scoring just doesn't click enough for me to really love it as much as I want to.7/20 Update: I ticked it back up a bit. I still really love this and think it is in the top tier of euro games. Have come back to it and am finding new love for it.

I would always rather play Brass, unless I'd been playing too much Brass recently--in which case I'd love me some Concordia.The cards are what make this so much fun, and the cards introduced in the Venus expansion are an absolutely essential addition, in my opinion.The amount that you can shaft your opponents is minimal, with the game instead offering you much more clever ways of profiting from your opponents moves. That's what I love about the game--you don't maximise value at the expense of others, but as a peripheral addition to their gains.Peaceful, thoughtful, and very pretty. An exquisite game that is sure to please.
Only played 2 player and thought it was my kind of game with the card play etc. Needs some more to get the seal of approval in my book.
Includes Salsa expansion

title: Instant Classic
description: My wife: "I can see why people talk about this game even after all this time." Simple rules, simple turns, but as the game progresses, the game reveals a surprising amount of depth. I think this is an excellent game to introduce to your Catan lovers if you'd like them to try something new.

title: Fairly dee...
description: Fairly deep Euro. My teen can play this no problem, but the theme is a bit lost on my younger daughter (9)Pretty easy to play once you get into it.You hardly ever feel blocked, or feel like you've wasted a turn. There's always something productive to do. The winner isn't usually obvious until the end (point salad to a large extent) but you always feel like you had a good game.Adult group enjoyed our first play. Minerva-based win.

title: Great, eas...
description: Great, easy to explain euro. Like most Euros, thee crux of the game is determining the most efficient course of action based on what your opponents are doing. Player interaction is minimal, but does exist and can throw wrenches into your plan.

title: It may not...
description: It may not technically be a rondel game, but it sure feels like a rondel game. Probably one of the more interesting games from this designer. Choose a route/path, hit it hard, and get the cards that score you points for that path. Harder said than done.

title: Maybe I do...
description: Maybe I don't get the game's engine but to me it just feels a mess of decisions and quite a lot of downtime meanwhile.

description: Designer: Mac Gerdts (Imperial 2030, Transatlantic, Antike)Publisher: 999 GamesPlayer count: 2-5 Weight: medium heavyMechanics: economic / deck buildingSetting: Roman empireTheme: fairPlay time: 90-120 minutesMac Gerdts' best design so far. Í've played a handful of games with various player counts and every game has been a lot of fun and I have not yet come across anyone who disliked the game. There are several expansion out there with other maps and other resources (Salsa expansion). Verdict:Definite keeper in my collection and in my top 10 games.

title: Really pre...
description: Really pretty.  But just too dry for my taste.  It feels more like a puzzle than a game.EDIT:  This has actually grown on me now that I've played it a few more times.  Very elegant rules and scoring system.  As the scoring is basically kept until the end AP players are not able to spend ages doing maths in the last turns and bring things to a crawl.

title: Rating at ...
description: Rating at one play using BGG standard rating system.  Had a lot of fun playing!  It's pretty amazing to have a euro game that is not about scarcity of resources, but more about being purposeful and efficient with the glut of resources available.  Wife also enjoyed the game and won 146 to 141.  Looking forward to more plays!

description:

title: Really enj...
description: Really enjoyed my play through of this game. I think the way players use the board + the deck of cards makes for a good tactical challenge without weighing down the game with Euro-math.

title: 2/1/19: Is...
description: 2/1/19: Is there anything this game is missing? Interaction with other players, light area control, hand management, card drafting, resource exchanging...all of my favorite actions wrapped up in a single game. This needs an insert and to be played more. One of my favorite games to play.

title: Easy to le...
description: Easy to learn and teach with good, solid mechanics.  Very hard to tell who the winner is going to be unless you are carefully watching everything other players are doing and performing a lot of mental math which I like because it keeps everybody engaged the whole game.

title: Astounding...
description: Astoundingly good game. Simple actions, but the depth lies in taking the right ones at the right times. This has the kind of player interaction I love, where you can make choices that mess with other players' future choices, even if you're not actively changing their game state. Who needs war? This is trade!
